snippet: The secretary of state sought to highlight commonalities between China and the United States after the Chinese dismissed assertions that hackers had infiltrated federal computer systems.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, speaking at the annual Strategic and Economic Dialogue, asserts that there is no United States strategy to be in conflict with China, and tries to press cyber-espionage as an important issue.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The secretary of state sought to highlight commonalities between China and the United States after the Chinese dismissed assertions that hackers had infiltrated federal computer systems.

headline.main: Kerry Assures China That the U.S. Can Have Many Allies in Asia
headline.print_headline: Kerry Assures China That the U.S. Can Have Many Allies in Asia

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
